summary.content: Mozilla has released two new versions of their software. The Mozilla “Application Suite” is now at version 1.4 Beta, while the latest stable release is still 1.3.1. Mozilla has also released the first official version of … (wait for it) … Mozilla Firebird™! The new release is version 0.6. Mozilla Firebird™ is going to be integrated into the full-scale Mozilla project by version 1.5, as the Mozilla Project is going to be “decentralized”, if you will. For those interested (and who don’t already know the URL’s), you can check out Mozilla’s Roadmap and Mozilla’s Branding Strategy.

content.html:
Mozilla has released two new versions of their software. The Mozilla “Application Suite” is now at version 1.4 Beta, while the latest stable release is still 1.3.1.

Mozilla has also released the first official version of … (wait for it) … Mozilla Firebird™! The new release is version 0.6. Mozilla Firebird™ is going to be integrated into the full-scale Mozilla project by version 1.5, as the Mozilla Project is going to be “decentralized”, if you will.

For those interested (and who don’t already know the URL’s), you can check out Mozilla’s Roadmap and Mozilla’s Branding Strategy.
content.plain:
Mozilla has released two new versions of their software. The Mozilla “Application Suite” is now at version 1.4 Beta, while the latest stable release is still 1.3.1.
Mozilla has also released the first official version of … (wait for it) … Mozilla Firebird™! The new release is version 0.6. Mozilla Firebird™ is going to be integrated into the full-scale Mozilla project by version 1.5, as the Mozilla Project is going to be “decentralized”, if you will.
For those interested (and who don’t already know the URL’s), you can check out Mozilla’s Roadmap and Mozilla’s Branding Strategy.
content.source:
Mozilla has released two new versions of their software. The [Mozilla “Application Suite”]({{% wayback "http://www.mozilla.org/releases/" %}}) is now at version [1.4 Beta]({{% wayback "http://www.mozilla.org/releases/index.html#1.4b" %}}), while the latest *stable* release is still [1.3.1]({{% wayback "http://www.mozilla.org/releases/index.html#1.3.1" %}}).

Mozilla has also released the first official version of … (wait for it) … [Mozilla Firebird™!]({{% wayback "http://www.mozilla.org/projects/firebird/" %}}) The new release is version 0.6. Mozilla Firebird™ is going to be integrated into the full-scale Mozilla project by version 1.5, as the Mozilla Project is going to be “decentralized”, if you will.

For those interested (and who don’t already know the URL’s), you can check out [Mozilla’s Roadmap]({{% wayback "http://www.mozilla.org/roadmap.html" %}} "Where is this project going?") and [Mozilla’s Branding Strategy]({{% wayback "http://www.mozilla.org/roadmap/branding.html" %}} "Planned product name changes, and what to call upcoming releases.").
